Class Main

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • Main

  • public class Main
extends javafx.application.Application
    Main class has all the different pages as its members and here the grid is created based on the user's choices and the input made by the user is placed in the grid by the play(). the rotation transistion of spheres is also done here.

        public void start(javafx.stage.Stage stage)

      • recreate

        public static void recreate(javafx.scene.Group[][] r,
                            javafx.scene.Group root,
                            javafx.scene.shape.Rectangle[][] grid2,
                            javafx.scene.paint.PhongMaterial[] m,
                            double rad)
        This function is called when the undo button is pressed, it reads the content from the file abc.txt where the grid from the previous move have been maintained to update the back end grid and it then calls the check() function to make the same changes in the front end grid.
        Parameters:
        r - This a 2D array of Group representing each cell in the front end Grid
        root - This is the main Group in which r and other components of the grid are present
        grid2 - This is a 2D array of rectangles present in the grid that are needed to find the centre of the cell in which the Sphere is to be added
        m - This is a 1D array of PhongMaterial the different materials that a sphere can have
        rad - This is the radius of the sphere to be added in a cell of the grid.

      • playerSettings

        public void playerSettings()
                    throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This function is called when the player clicks on the PlayerSettings button to change the menu by first calling playerSettingscall() then changing the scene.
        Parameters:
        Nothing -
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • playGame

        public void playGame(java.lang.String s)
              throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This function is called when the play button is pressed. This functions depending on the size requested, calls play() function to create the front end grid
        Parameters:
        s - determines whether the grid is 9x6 or 15X10
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • playercolor

        public void playercolor(int turn)
                 throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This method is called when in the player settings menu the Player selects whose color they want to change. It further calls pcolor() where the color panel is displayed to the user.
        Parameters:
        turn - This tells us for which Player the color has to be changed
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • callwinner

        public void callwinner(int i)
                throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This function is called if checkwinner() returns true. It displays the player who has won the game and provides to either start a new game or return to the main menu.
        Parameters:
        i - This is the Player no. who has won
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • resumeGame

        public void resumeGame()
                throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This function is called when the resume button is pressed to create a grid of the size that was saved from the last game that was played.
        Parameters:
        Nothing -
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • callmain

        public void callmain(int turn,
                     javafx.scene.paint.Color c)
              throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This functions is called when the Player clicks on Back to Menu button.
        Parameters:
        turn - This is the player that is being added to the ArrayList total
        c - Color for the Player that is being added to the list
